Company policy (based on stated labor regulation) requires written employee consent for any medical treatment, and for employees under 18 it also requires a parent/guardian signature unless the treatment is needed to prevent immediate serious harm; the clinician confirms the employee is healthy and there is no immediate risk in waiting. The 17-year-old employee wants both doses scheduled today without informing their parents and offers to pay $250 now and the rest later.
